This works as it does in Pathfinder (@Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.1kGNdIIhuglAjIp9]{Treat Wounds}),Â  but you need a @Compendium[hopefinder.equipment.PHClSyVXwCmuYZRk]{First Aid Kit} (not healer's tools) or a @Compendium[hopefinder.equipment.ozj1ME9TaDsTOYMF]{Bandage}. It can be performed untrained and the DC and amount of healing is different, as noted on the chart below (for a greater amount, see the @Compendium[hopefinder.feats.y9oAlWcDVlCAucqA]{Surgery} feat in the Advanced Feats section on page 57 of the Hopefinder Survivor's Guide). Treat wounds can also heal bruises at the same time (twice that number on a critical success).

Proficiency DC Success Healing Critical Healing Bruise
Untrained @Check[type:medicine|dc:10] [[/r {1d4}[healing]]]{1d4} [[/r {2d4}[healing]]]{2d4} 0
Trained* @Check[type:medicine|dc:15] [[/r {1d4+2}[healing]]]{1d4+2} [[/r {2d4+2}[healing]]]{2d4+2} 1
Expert* @Check[type:medicine|dc:20] [[/r {1d4+4}[healing]]]{1d4+4} [[/r {2d4+4}[healing]]]{2d4+4} 1
Master* @Check[type:medicine|dc:25] [[/r {1d4+6}[healing]]]{1d4+6} [[/r {2d4+6}[healing]]]{2d4+6} 2
Legendary* @Check[type:medicine|dc:30] [[/r {1d4+8}[healing]]]{1d4+8} [[/r {2d4+8}[healing]]]{2d4+8} 2

*Rolling against a higher DC is optional.
